unnormalised: My grandfather always told us stories about 15/08/1947. He was just a boy then, living in Lahore. He remembered the sheer joy, the flags, and the sweets, but also the confusion and fear as the Partition unfolded. He said at 12:00 AM, everyone poured out into the streets, shouting 'Jai Hind!' He'd later say, with a sigh, that while independence was a great thing, the date 14/08 was forever etched in his mind with sorrow. He always made sure we understood the importance of remembering both 15 Aug and what came before.
